intro: Aylostera waltheriana, commonly known as the Walther's aylostera, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
